summary.para: Create a Direct3D 10.1 device that represents the display adapter.

param.name: pAdapter
param.para: Pointer to the display adapter (see ) when creating a hardware device; otherwise set this parameter to NULL. If NULL is specified when creating a hardware device, Direct3D will use the first adapter enumerated by .

param.name: DriverType
param.para: The device-driver type (see ). The driver type determines the type of device you will create.

param.name: Software
param.para: This is set to NULL except for D3D10_DRIVER_TYPE_SOFTWARE driver types.

param.name: Flags
param.para: Optional. Device creation flags (see ) that enable API layers. These flags can be bitwise OR'd together.

param.name: HardwareLevel
param.para: The version of hardware that is available for acceleration (see ).

param.name: SDKVersion
param.para: Bit flag that indicates the version of the SDK. Should be D3D10_1_SDK_VERSION, defined in D3D10.h.

param.name: ppDevice
param.para: Address of a pointer to the device created (see ).

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: To create a device and a swap chain at the same time, see .
This method requires Windows Vista Service Pack 1, Windows Server 2008, or later release of Windows.
